Reviews.Content: good price/comfort it was good price for this room and service (70 euro double room). we stayed at Dependence (small bilding at the courtyard of hotel with independent entrance). it was delicious breakfest with friendly staff. but we had to take taxi from station to hotel because in the hotel website we couldn't find information about bus direction and name of bus stop. also the free map in the hotel was old: the route of bus N14 had changed and we had to come back on foot in the evening.
Reviews.Author: russakowalena

Reviews.Content: Out of town..... This hotel is very comfortable and clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful, but unfortunately the hotel is too far from the centre of town, which is where you need to be to enjoy the galleries etc. I would say with a strong breeze behind you it probably takes approx 1 hour to walk to the centre. Its a short taxi ride, 8 euros or so and a slightly longer bus ride. By the fourth day we were using taxi's all the time, but this can prove difficult late at night as there isn't a central place to go to for taxi's past 10pm, and they don't seem to like being flagged down?Overall this hotel is a very good three star hotel, but the distance is a problem.
Reviews.Author: stuart_cox

Reviews.Content: Super value hotel My wife and I have just returned from a tour of Italy. We started the tour with friends at the Grifone for four nights. I personally would never have booked this hotel as it further away from the centre of town than I usually like to stay, so I am glad I was not the one to pick the hotel in Florence. I would recomend this hotel to anyone, the rooms were super, the buffet breakfast was more than adequate and the staff could not be faulted.Travelling into the city centre is a short bus ride on the No14 to the station or a 45 min walk along the river bank(reserved for the couples with a bit of romance still in their lives).I will stay here again whenever we visit Florence.
Reviews.Author: bargaintraveller

Reviews.Content: far The hotel was very out of the way for downtown Florence. We had 6 people in our traveling party. When booking we were under the impression that it was much closer to the city center. Also there are 2 buildings associated with this hotel. We asked for the newer section but it was anything but new. It was not attached to the main building had to walk down the street for breakfast. It was stale and smelled old in the new section. Asked to be moved to the main building said that it was quite a bit more expensive because it was the main building and it housed the breakfast. Not very friendly people running the front. We only stayed 1 night at this hotel. Rooms were big, big bathroom but felt out of the way and that not many tourists use the second building. Dead mosquitos were squished on the walls and just left there. One room even had a huge hole in the wall. Made front desk aware, they didn't care. Felt secluded. Would not say here again. On the bright side breakfast was good.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Hmmm, out of the way I should have been a little cautious when I couldn't see a telephone number for this hotel on the web. It's a bit like launching into the void. The description of the hotel being in the Santa Croce area is a bit on the optimistic side. Yes, there is a bus at the end of the block that will take you into town, but a twenty minute taxi ride in full traffic isn't cheap. It's on the edge of the tourist maps, a very 1960-70s place with a lobby with fixed seats and a bit grubby. It clearly does group bookings. The room was adequate and quiet, but it being so far out of town, was not really appropriate for a single female traveller. Luckily, they were able to change my booking and check me out after the first night despite the dire warnings of the internet booking agency, for which I thank them. Clearly, the Grifone is undergoing a refit - there was no bar and the outside space they advertise is closed at the moment (late May), so hopefully it will improve, although obviously, the location will not! It is neither walkable into town in 90 degree heat nor hoppable (I twisted my ankle on broken paving slabs just on the way to the bus stop!).
Reviews.Author: Eaden
